page.title: 06BarleyBulls in rural Sowerby
page.content: In an area where intensive pig and poultry farming is prevalent, one farm in our block concentrates on Barley Bull rearing. Week old bull calves are bought in batches and group housed in large airy sheds. They are individually fed on liquid calf_mix protein, and at 8 weeks are introduced to a mixture of rolled barley, fish meal and black treacle. On attaining the weight of 400 Kg at the end of approx. 11 months, the calves are ready for marketing. To hasten growth, hormone bullets, supplied by a veterinary surgeon are planted into the flesh behind the ear, 2 months prior to killing. This practice, appertaining to poultry fattening, is now banned by E.E.C. rules.
